criterion_text: Patients suffering from inflammatory joint disease such as rheumatoid arthritis.
Hypertrophic or infiltrative cardiomyopathy
Active autoimmune disease.
Inflammatory arthritis, such as rheumatoid or psoriatic arthritis
Inflammatory arthritis
Chronic autoimmune diseases such as, but not limited to: lupus, multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis
Previous juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) treatment with tofacitinib.
Inflammatory arthritis that require disease modifying drugs (e.g. rheumatoid arthritis)
Inflammatory breast cancer.
Presence of an underlying inflammatory disease in the affected knee, including Rheumatoid Arthritis, Psoriatic Arthritis, Gout, Pseudogout, or other inflammatory disease.
Have been diagnosed with a GI malabsorption disorder (i.e., Inflammatory bowel disease, Crohn's disease) or Celiac disease
Active known or suspected exclusionary autoimmune disease

Patients with history of any autoimmune disease:inflammatory bowel disease, (including ulcerative colitis and Crohn's Disease), rheumatoid arthritis, systemic progressive sclerosis (scleroderma), systemic lupus erythematous (SLE) autoimmune vasculitis, CNS or motor neuropathy considered to be of autoimmune origin.
Active inflammatory gastrointestinal disease, such as inflammatory bowel disease
Patients with inflammatory arthritis.
Chronic rhinosinusitis
Inflammatory or granulomatous diseases
Allergic rhinitis
Current or prior septic arthritis
Active mucositis
Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) or other autoimmune and chronic inflammatory diseases (i.e. inflammatory bowel disease, sarcoidosis)
Inflammatory bowel disease that is uncontrolled or on active treatment (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis)
Ocular inflammation or uveitis
Patients with malignancy-associated dermatomyositis
Patients with inflammatory arthritis
Rheumatoid arthritis and other types of autoimmune and inflammatory joint disease, with the exception of osteoarthritis and fibromyalgia
Collagen vascular disease (lupus, scleroderma, rheumatoid arthritis)
Patients with active inflammatory bowel disease
Patient has a diagnosis of Non-Inflammatory Degenerative Joint Disease.

Patients with history of any autoimmune disease:inflammatory bowel disease, (including ulcerative colitis and Crohn's Disease), rheumatoid arthritis, systemic progressive sclerosis (scleroderma), systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) autoimmune vasculitis, central nervous system (CNS) or motor neuropathy considered to be of autoimmune origin.
Progressive or recurrent contracture due to inflammatory disease such as rheumatoid arthritis, juvenile idiopathic arthritis or chondrolysis.
Active autoimmune diseases requiring systemic treatments
Active allergic rhinitis
Primary diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis
Patients with inflammatory arthritides.
